form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Tuberville introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To modify eligibility requirements for amateur sports governing organizations.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protection of Women in Olympic and Amateur Sports Act.

subsection.text: Section 220501(b) of title 36, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: female means an individual who has, had, will have—or would have, but for a developmental or genetic anomaly or historical accident—the reproductive system that at some point produces, transports, and utilizes eggs for fertilization.

male means an individual who has, had, will have—or would have, but for a developmental or genetic anomaly or historical accident—the reproductive system that at some point produces, transports, and utilizes sperm for fertilization.
sex means an individual’s biological sex, either male or female.

subsection.text: Section 220522 of title 36, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (18), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (19), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
prohibits a person whose sex is male from participating in an amateur athletic competition that is designated for females, women, or girls.
